questions.question: BCD-to-Excess-3 Code Conversion is a example of a _____________.

explanations.a: BCD-to-Excess-3 conversion involves adding binary 3 to a 4-bit BCD input, which is typically done using a 4-bit parallel adder.

questions.question: For a circuit with k lines _____________ single stuck-at fault is possible.

answers.d: k2 single stuck-at fault is possible

explanations.b: Each of the k lines can have two stuck-at faults (stuck-at-0 and stuck-at-1), resulting in a total of 2k possible single stuck-at faults.

questions.question: Stuck open (off) fault occur/s due to _____________.

answers.a: An incomplete contact (open) of source to drain node
answers.b: Large separation of drain or source diffusion from the gate

explanations.c: Stuck-open faults occur due to incomplete source-drain contact or large separation of diffusion regions from the gate, both leading to circuit disconnection.

questions.question: The BCD and Excess-3 code equivalent for the number 27 is _____________.

explanations.d: BCD for 2 and 7 is 0010 0111; adding 3 (0011) to each digit gives Excess-3 as 0101 1010.
